crops.name: Maize
crops.description: Maize is Kenyaâ€™s staple crop, widely grown in the highlands with fertile soils.

crops.name: Beans
crops.description: Beans are a key source of protein and do well in cool, temperate climates.

crops.name: Spinach
crops.description: Spinach is a fast-growing leafy vegetable that thrives in warm, humid regions.

crops.name: Coconut
crops.description: Coconuts are a coastal tropical crop, valued for food, oil, and fiber.

crops.name: Mango
crops.description: Mangoes thrive in tropical regions and are among the most popular fruits in Kenya.

crops.name: Sorghum
crops.description: Sorghum is drought-tolerant, making it ideal for arid and semi-arid lands.

crops.name: Millet
crops.description: Millet is a hardy cereal grown in dry regions, valued for porridge and flour.

crops.name: Cowpeas
crops.description: Cowpeas are both a food crop and fodder, well suited to semi-arid climates.

crops.name: Irish Potato
crops.description: Irish potatoes grow best in cool highland climates with fertile soils.

crops.name: Cabbage
crops.description: Cabbage is a leafy vegetable common in highland farms, grown for both home use and markets.
